definitions.definition: Without others or anything further ; exclusively .
examples: My heart is hers, and hers only .
The cat sat only on the mat. It kept off the sofa.
The only scientist to have won three Nobel prizes .
The cat only sat on the mat. It didn't scratch it.
If there were only one more ticket!

definitions.definition: Emphasizing something that is just or necessary.
examples: It's only fair to let him borrow your kite, after you've had his toys all day.
He'd been belittling her for years. It's only natural that she left.

definitions.definition: Used to express surprise or consternation at an action.
examples: She's only gone and run off with the milkman!

definitions.definition: Introduces a disappointing or surprising outcome that renders futile something previously mentioned.
examples: They rallied from a three-goal deficit only to lose in the final two minutes of play.
I spent years studying a degree only to learn there was no requirement for such a certification.
I helped him out only for him to betray me.

main_definition: Without others or anything further ; exclusively .
secondary_definitions: Emphasizing something that is just or necessary.
( British ) Used to express surprise or consternation at an action.
Introduces a disappointing or surprising outcome that renders futile something previously mentioned.
